summary: A timeline of FTX's demise showing how the situation at Alameda Research developed and ended up ripping the exchange apart.
title: A complete timeline of FTX: From Alameda's spiraling debt to its dramatic implosion
content: It's difficult to pinpoint exactly where things took a turn for the worst for FTX. Was it the millions worth of lost XRP tokens? Nishad Singh coding "Allow Negative" at the behest of Sam Bankman-Fried? FTX's befuddled bank accounts for customer deposits? The infamously leaked balance sheets?
We all know the end of the story. Now, testimonies from former FTX and Alameda Research employees shed new light on FTX's spiral toward destruction.
The Block poured through hundreds of pages of court transcripts to cobble together a complete timeline. Here's what we know so far:
The above moments are based on a combination of sources, including testimony from former FTX executives in the SBF's trial.
Update: Fixed the amount of debt Yedida told SBF about.
